name: Zeroth Law of Thermodynamics
description: The Zeroth Law of Thermodynamics establishes the concept of temperature and thermal equilibrium. It states that if two systems are each in thermal equilibrium with a third system, then they are in thermal equilibrium with each other. This principle underpins the ability to measure temperature and is fundamental in the study and application of thermodynamics.
source_reliability_assessment: High - Established Scientific Law/Principle widely confirmed by empirical evidence and theoretical consistency.
symbolic_ai_implementation_note: Can be used to infer thermal equilibrium between two systems if both are known to be in equilibrium with a third, facilitating reasoning about energy transfer and system states in a knowledge base.

name: First Law of Thermodynamics
description: The First Law of Thermodynamics, also known as the Law of Conservation of Energy, states that energy cannot be created or destroyed in an isolated system. Energy can only be transformed from one form to another, ensuring the total energy remains constant. This principle underpins much of physical science, from classical mechanics to chemical reactions.
source_reliability_assessment: High - Established Scientific Law/Principle widely confirmed by empirical evidence and theoretical consistency.
symbolic_ai_implementation_note: This law can be represented in a symbolic AI system to ensure energy balance in simulations or calculations, enforcing that the change in internal energy (ΔU) equals heat added to the system (Q) minus work done by the system (W).

name: Newton's First Law of Motion
description: Newton's First Law of Motion, also known as the Law of Inertia, states that an object will remain at rest or in uniform motion in a straight line unless acted upon by an external force. It underscores the relationship between the motion of an object and the forces acting upon it, serving as a cornerstone in classical mechanics.
source_reliability_assessment: High - Established Scientific Law/Principle widely confirmed by empirical evidence and theoretical consistency.
symbolic_ai_implementation_note: This law can be represented in a symbolic AI system as a rule that prevents changes to an object's motion state unless a net external force is applied, facilitating simulations of physical systems.

name: Second Law of Thermodynamics
description: The Second Law of Thermodynamics states that the total entropy of an isolated system can never decrease over time, and is constant if and only if all processes are reversible. It signifies that heat cannot spontaneously flow from a colder location to a hotter area without adding work, and it provides a fundamental criterion for the direction of spontaneous processes.
source_reliability_assessment: High - Established Scientific Law/Principle widely confirmed by empirical evidence and theoretical consistency.
symbolic_ai_implementation_note: This rule can be used in a symbolic AI's knowledge base to determine the feasibility of a process in a thermodynamic system, ensuring that proposed changes do not violate the increase of entropy principle for isolated systems.

name: Principle of Quantum Superposition
description: The principle of quantum superposition states that a quantum system can exist in multiple states or configurations simultaneously, as long as it is not observed. This principle is fundamental to quantum mechanics, underpinning phenomena such as quantum interference and entanglement, and is crucial for technologies like quantum computing.
source_reliability_assessment: High - Established Scientific Law/Principle widely confirmed by empirical evidence and theoretical consistency.
symbolic_ai_implementation_note: This principle can be represented in a symbolic AI system as a rule that allows a quantum state to be a combination of basis states, with operations on this state reflecting its superposed nature until measurement.

name: Ohm's Law
description: Ohm's Law is a fundamental principle in electrical engineering and physics that describes the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance in an electrical circuit. It states that the current through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the voltage across the two points, provided the temperature remains constant.
source_reliability_assessment: High - Established Scientific Law/Principle widely confirmed by empirical evidence and theoretical consistency.
symbolic_ai_implementation_note: Used to calculate current, voltage, or resistance in a circuit given the other two values.
